Made in Foreign Currency 5.21.4
Field Collection group managers and territory managers are responsible for ensuring the guidance and procedures described in this IRM are complied

a. Director, Field Collection Report - This monthly report encompasses all Field Collection including International and provides measures on the formance of Field Collection. b. International Territory Report - This monthly report provides measures on the performance of the International territory. c. Form
, Teller’s Error Advice - This report is sent to the Group Manager by Submission Processing to report an error or late remittance. Reviews:

Collection Policy will conduct ad hoc International program reviews as necessary to verify compliance with IRM requirements and to address Treasury Inspector General for Tax Administration/U.S. Government Ac
countability Office ﬁndings. Case reviews are conducted by Group Managers to ensure compliance with this IRM.
5.21 International and Insular Issues
c. IRM
, Remittance Control Reviews, requires Group Managers to periodically conduct a review of control procedures to ensure staff is complying with the procedures in IRM

, Daily Report of Collection Activity. d. Operational reviews are conducted by the Territory Manager and Area Director annually to evaluate program delivery and conformance to admin- istrative and compliance requirements.

Publication 54 advises taxpayers that they must pay their taxes in U.S. dollars. However, sometimes a taxpayer will send a payment in foreign currency and is unable or unwilling to substitute the payment for one in U.S. dollars.
Example: Request for foreign cash conversion: 2500 Euros TC 670
Attach Form 3244 and the payment to the daily Form
Note: The payment will be stripped from Form 795 and transhipped to the appro- priate Campus for processing by Campus Receipt and Control.
Note: Such payments may take in excess of
days to post to IDRS. (
) Taxpayers may make payment by a credit card issued by a foreign bank, provided it is a credit card accepted by IRS processors, e.g., Visa or Foreign card. (
) See IRM
, Credit Card, and IRM
, Credit or Debit Payments (Pay by Phone or Internet), for additional information. (
) Taxpayers who reside outside the United States may pay federal tax by electronic transfer. Transfer (
) See IRM
, Federal Tax Application (FTA) Same-day Wire, for lines on making federal tax payments by electronic transfer. (
) If the taxpayer does not have a U.S. bank account or is not affiliated with U.S. bank, a cash management account can be used through the Federal Tax Payment System (EFTPS). (

) A cash management account uses a Routing Transit Number (RTN), also known as the American Banking Association (ABA) number, for brokerage houses to receive payments for stock transactions from taxpayers living outside and inside the U.S. (
) The RTN/ABA number used from the cash management account can be to set up a PIN and password with EFTPS and therefore can be used to payments to the IRS. (
) There are no fees associated with payments using a Cash Management Account.
Note: Such payments may take in excess of 30 days to post to IDRS.
